result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Killerlain Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 14CT623.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply. To be paid from all prison accounts of any nature and prison wages.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $278  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kraak Storage, JP, RC, LC & AC.
Tax returns to be filed and copy to agent with any refund to restitution.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
